0.title: ED raids over 40 locations of Vivo, related firms in money laundering probe
0.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Tuesday conducted raids at Chinese smartphone manufacturing company Vivo and related firms, officials said. The raids were carried out at 44 locations across the country under sections of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act. Earlier in May, local units of ZTE Corporation and Vivo were investigated for alleged financial irregularities.

1.title: HC grants bail to Shiv Sena MP's associate in money laundering case
1.article_body: Bombay High Court has granted bail to Shiv Sena MP Bhavana Gawali's associate, Saeed Khan, in connection with a money laundering case. Khan was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the case in September 2021. Khan was accused of converting a trust, associated with Gawali, into a company and becoming its director for wrongful gains.

2.title: Christian Eriksen likely to join Manchester United
2.article_body: Denmark's Christian Eriksen has reportedly agreed to join Manchester United on a three-year deal after his contract at Brentford ended last month. Eriksen had joined Brentford after Inter Milan terminated his contract due to his cardiac device implant. Eriksen suffered a cardiac arrest during Denmark's game against Finland at the European Championship in June last year.

3.title: Centre should release white paper on employment: T'gana minister
3.article_body: Telangana Finance Minister T Harish Rao on Monday asked Centre to release a white paper on filling two crore jobs every year. "BJP...promised to offer two crore jobs every year and in eight years, 16 crore jobs had to be offered but...central government failed," Rao said. On the other hand, Telangana government has filled about 1.35 lakh posts, he added.

4.title: 70-year-old woman beaten to death by villagers in J'khand over 'witchcraft'
4.article_body: A 70-year-old woman was beaten to death by villagers in Jharkhand’s Garhwa district, as they claimed that the woman practised "witchcraft", police said on Tuesday. In a complaint, the deceased woman’s family alleged that five persons dragged her at least 200 metres from her house on Sunday at around 8:30 pm and beat her to death with sticks.

5.title: Delhi reports 32 dengue cases in June, 143 cases so far in 2022
5.article_body: According to a civic report, Delhi reported 32 dengue cases in June, taking this year's tally to 143. No related deaths have been reported in the national capital until now this year. Moreover, no new cases were reported this month until July 2. Also, Delhi has recorded 27 cases of malaria and eight cases of chikungunya so far in 2022.

6.title: My son Stefan likes to intimidate me on the court: Novak Djokovic
6.article_body: Talking about his son Stefan, Novak Djokovic said, "He likes to intimidate me on the court with finishing the swing here. He knows I don't like that particularly." "Whenever he does that, he always laughs because he knows," added Djokovic. "I try to use every available opportunity...to play with him because Stefan's...fully immersed into tennis," he stated.

7.title: Delhi BJP leader Kapil Mishra claims receiving death threat via email
7.article_body: Delhi BJP leader Kapil Mishra on Monday claimed that he received a death threat through email. In a tweet, Mishra shared a screenshot of the email that read, "Terrorist Kapil Mishra you will not be allowed to live long." Mishra further wrote that he isn't scared of such threats, adding, "Our campaign to help...families of victims of Jihadist violence...will continue...aggressively."

8.title: Razorpay blocks Alt News donation link, restores after 'clarity'
8.article_body: Days after fact-checker Mohammed Zubair's arrest, online payment gateway Razorpay deactivated the donation link for Alt News. However, the company restored it "following clarity on the issue". The company said it had temporarily disabled the account during the preliminary investigation by law enforcement authorities. This comes after Alt News refuted allegations of receiving funds from overseas.

9.title: If I play murderer, does it make me one: Kiara on criticism for 'Kabir..' role
9.article_body: While talking about being criticised for her role in the movie 'Kabir Singh', actress Kiara Advani asked, "If I play a murderer in my next film, does it make me one?" "It's hypocritical to praise actors who otherwise play a grey shade and then criticise them when they play a grey shade of a regular character," she added.

10.title: Ukraine is in talks with Turkey, UN on grain exports: Zelenskyy
10.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Ukraine is holding talks with Turkey and the UN on securing guarantees for grain exports. "This is a very important thing that someone guarantees...security of ships for this or that country, apart from Russia, which we don't trust. We, therefore, need security for those ships which will come here to load foodstuffs," he added.

11.title: We are optimistic about winning Edgbaston Test: Eng's Alex Lees
11.article_body: English opener Alex Lees has said that the England team is "optimistic" about winning the Edgbaston Test and levelling the series against India at 2-2. "If we bat well for the first 30-40 minutes tomorrow (Tuesday) morning, we should be in a pretty strong position...There is an ultimate belief from one to 11 [that] we can do it," Lees said.

12.title: Singapore Prez, Parliament Speaker, Culture Min test +ve for COVID
12.article_body: Singapore President Halimah Yacob, Speaker of Parliament Tan Chuan-Jin, and Culture Minister Edwin Tong have tested for COVID-19. The 67-year-old President, who is vaccinated and boosted, said that she is experiencing mild symptoms of COVID-19. Over the last 28 days, Singapore has reported 1,40,965 coronavirus infections. The country has recorded more than 14 lakh COVID-19 cases so far.

13.title: Microsoft delegation gets 'Peace Prize' from Ukrainian President
13.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov took to Twitter to announce that a Microsoft delegation has been awarded 'Peace Prize' from the President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "We are grateful to have you on the light side of digital. Microsoft stands for truth and for peace," Fedorov said. Earlier, Microsoft took several actions in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

14.title: Filmmaker Quentin Tarantino, wife Daniella blessed with a baby girl
14.article_body: Filmmaker Quentin Tarantino and his wife, model Daniella, have been blessed with their second child, a baby girl. The 59-year-old director and his 38-year-old wife had announced in February that they are expecting their second child. Their first child, son Leo, was born in February 2020. Tarantino and Daniella got married in November 2018.

15.title: NFT sales hit 12-month low in June after cryptocurrency crash
15.article_body: Sales of non-fungible tokens (NFTs) reached a 12-month low in June following a downturn in the cryptocurrency market. The average number of daily sales of NFTs fell to around 19,000 in June in comparison to its peak between August and November last year when NFT sales were frequently topping more than 2,00,000 per day.

16.title: Haryana agrees to provide ACs in district attorneys offices after HC's order
16.article_body: The Haryana government has decided to provide facility of air conditioners (ACs) in offices of district attorneys (DAs) in the state. The decision comes after Haryana Attorney's Welfare Association filed a petition in the HC. Hearing the matter, the Punjab and Haryana High Court said that the request of the district attorneys "appears to be genuine", given their working conditions.

17.title: I merely quoted to my friend, no stooping factor: Resul on calling RRR 'gay love story'
17.article_body: 'Baahubali' producer Shobu Yarlagadda criticised Oscar-winning film sound designer Resul Pookutty for calling 'RRR' a 'gay love story', saying, "Extremely disappointed that someone of your accomplishments can stoop so low!" Pookutty replied, "I merely quoted to my friend, the banter that already exists in public domain." He added, "There's no stooping factor...You don't have to take it seriously."

18.title: French actress Judith shares pics of her domestic abuse injuries; says 'I'm exhausted'
18.article_body: French actress Judith Chemla took to Instagram to post pictures of her domestic abuse injuries. "A year ago my face was injured, blue, purple under my eye. I have so much evidence that he continues to try and harm me," she wrote. "I am exhausted. What does it take to make him leave me alone?" she added.

19.title: Top Congress leaders discuss strategy for upcoming Gujarat polls
19.article_body: Congress leaders met on Monday to discuss the party's strategy for this year's Gujarat Assembly elections. According to PTI, the party finalised a strategy during the four-hour-long meet and decided to raise the issues of Dalits, tribals and farmers during their poll campaign. The meet was attended by several leaders including Priyanka Gandhi, Ajay Maken, P Chidambaram and Randeep Surjewala.

20.title: 'Pushpa' makers approach Sethupathi for a crucial role in sequel: Reports
20.article_body: The makers of Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa' have reportedly approached Vijay Sethupathi to play an important role in the film's sequel titled 'Pushpa: The Rule'. According to reports, Sethupathi was initially a part of the first part too but he opted out due to date issues. In addition to Arjun, the second part will also feature Fahadh Faasil and Rashmika Mandanna.

21.title: France's Schneider Electric to sell Russia unit to local team
21.article_body: France's Schneider Electric has agreed to sell its Russian unit to the local leadership team. The firm is expected to write-off up to $313 million in net book value as a result of the divestment. "Schneider Electric is planning an orderly transfer and is allocating resources to support the employees in Russia and Belarus through the process," it said.

22.title: Amarnath Yatra temporarily suspended due to bad weather
22.article_body: The Amarnath Yatra has been temporarily suspended owing to bad weather. A batch of around 3,000 pilgrims was reportedly stopped at the Nunwan base camp on the Pahalgam route, while 4,000 more people were stopped in Chanderkote in the Ramban district. About 72,000 people have visited the shrine since the yatra started on June 30.

23.title: Impossible for Federer to win 21st singles Major: Ex-women's world no. 1
23.article_body: Ex-world number one in women's doubles Pam Shriver said, "Regardless of Roger Federer's comeback pathway, winning a 21st singles Major seems impossible given his knees, age and the effort it takes." "A big question will be: Can Federer play the best-of-five format the Majors demand in 2023, when he will be 41 years old," added Shriver.

24.title: Organisers respond after Djokovic says 'Wimbledon turning into indoor event'
24.article_body: After Novak Djokovic questioned the scheduling of the evening matches at Wimbledon, the All England Club CEO Sally Bolton said, "Once you start the day, you have no idea when the day is going to finish." Djokovic had said, "If you're scheduled last on the Centre, you're going to end up a match under the roof, which changes the conditions."

25.title: Stolen majority: Shiv Sena after Maharashtra CM Shinde wins trust vote
25.article_body: A day after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde-led government proved its majority in the Assembly by surpassing the majority mark of 144, Shiv Sena termed it a "stolen majority". "BJP and Shinde faction got vote of confidence...This is a stolen majority. This is not the belief of 11 crore people of Maharashtra," Shiv Sena said in its mouthpiece 'Saamana'.

26.title: NC, PDP to jointly fight J&K elections
26.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir National Conference (NC) and the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) on Monday announced that they will jointly contest the Assembly elections. PDP President Mehbooba Mufti said, "We intend to contest the elections together as it is the will of the people that we should strive together for the restoration of our lost dignity."

27.title: Sinha vows he won't be 'rubber stamp' Prez, urges Murmu to do same
27.article_body: Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha on Monday tweeted that he pledges to be an "impartial custodian" of the Constitution and not a "silent or rubber stamp" President. He also urged BJP-led NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu to make the same pledge. "To ensure a better future for all Indians, the Rashtrapati (President) must work conscientiously," he said.

28.title: Trell Co-founder served legal notice over unpaid dues of ₹47 lakh
28.article_body: Trell Co-founder Bimal Kartheek Rebba has been served a legal notice by Creatify Web Services, which runs influencer management agency Idiotic Media, for unpaid dues amounting to ₹47 lakh. It has also demanded ₹5 lakh from Trell over mental agony and harassment. Earlier, it was reported that Trell hasn't paid some influencers for the last six to seven months.

29.title: 5 held in separate cases for sharing Udaipur murder video, photos with arms
29.article_body: Police arrested five people in separate cases in Rajasthan's Hanumangarh for allegedly circulating the video of Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal's murder and posting photos and videos with arms online. A 36-year-old was arrested for sharing the video and four others were arrested for posting photos and videos. Lal was beheaded by two men for supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma.

30.title: 68,000 encroachments removed, ₹844-cr property seized in 100 days: UP CM
30.article_body: On completion of the first 100 days of CM Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government's second term, he said that over 68,000 illegal encroachments were removed. Properties worth ₹844 crore, belonging to criminals and the mafia, were seized in the last 100 days, he added. Over 1.20 lakh loudspeakers were either removed or their decibel levels were reduced, Adityanath further said.

31.title: Battled horrible pain due to rib injury: Nadal on Indian Wells final loss
31.article_body: Recalling his defeat against American player Taylor Fritz in the final of the 2022 edition of Indian Wells, which ended his 20-match winning streak, Rafael Nadal said he was in "horrible pain" due to a rib injury. "I knew something was...very wrong during the match," added Nadal. "I'm tired of talking about my body...and...the problems I have," he stated.

32.title: PMC to give NOC only after poll aspirant pays illegal hoardings' fine
32.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced that it will only give a No Objection Certificate (NOC) to people who want to contest the civic body's elections after they pay the fine for putting up illegal hoardings. As per the rules, candidates must get NOCs from the civic body before contesting the elections, reported Hindustan Times.

33.title: Accused got bike, ₹10,000 to kill Amravati chemist who supported Nupur Sharma: Police
33.article_body: Amravati Police Commissioner Arti Singh has said that the mastermind Irfan paid ₹10,000 and a motorcycle to the accused to kill chemist Umesh Kolhe over a social media post supporting Nupur Sharma. The accused are Muddasar Ahmad (22), Shahrukh Pathan (25), Abdul Taufiq (24), Shoaib Khan (22), Atib Rashid (22), Yusuf Khan (32), and alleged mastermind Shaikh Irfan Shaikh Rahim.

34.title: Not here to protect anyone: Karnataka CM Bommai to Congress
34.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai criticised Congress alleging that the party used to protect criminals when it was in power in the state. Speaking about the arrests of ADGP Amrit Paul and IAS officer J Manjunath, Bommai said that the accused would have been covered up if the Congress was in power. "We're not here to protect anyone," Bommai further said.

35.title: UP woman accuses husband of giving triple talaq over dowry
35.article_body: A woman in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur has accused her husband of giving her divorce through the outlawed practice of triple talaq. He had been allegedly harassing her for dowry. The woman claimed that the accused and his family members beat her up on July 3, demanding dowry. When she refused, her husband divorced her by pronouncing 'talaq' thrice, she added.

36.title: TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan arrested over misleading video on Rahul Gandhi
36.article_body: TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan was arrested by Noida Police in Ghaziabad on Tuesday after misleading clips about Congress leader Rahul Gandhi were aired on his show. Gandhi called the SFI activists who vandalised his office "children", but his comments were aired as remarks on Udaipur murder accused. Cases were registered against Rohit Ranjan in several states.

37.title: K'taka records 749 COVID-19 cases, 696 reported in Bengaluru alone
37.article_body: Karnataka on Monday recorded 749 new cases of COVID-19, out of which 696 were reported in Bengaluru alone. According to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), the city reported zero deaths and 869 recoveries on Monday. With 6,075 active COVID-19 cases, the test positivity rate for the past seven days in Bengaluru stands at 5.22%, data showed.

38.title: U'khand villagers kill crocodile suspecting it killed boy; case filed
38.article_body: Villagers in Uttarakhand's Kumaon killed a crocodile by battering it with sticks on suspicion that it had killed a boy who was grazing cattle near a river. An x-ray was conducted, however, medical staff found no human body parts or bones in crocodile's stomach. A case will be filed under Wild Life (Protection) Act 1972, Divisional Forest Officer (DFO) said.

39.title: Tata Power signs MoU with Tamil Nadu for ₹3,000 cr solar plant
39.article_body: Tata Power has signed an MoU with the Tamil Nadu government to invest ₹3,000 crore for setting up a greenfield 4GW Cell and 4GW module solar manufacturing plant in Tamil Nadu. The facility will create over 2,000 employment opportunities with the majority being women employees. The investment will be made over a period of 16 months.

40.title: Hyd man sets himself ablaze during marriage of woman he loved, dies
40.article_body: A 20-year-old man died after setting himself on fire at a marriage hall in Hyderabad where the woman he loved was being married to someone else. The incident took place on June 30 when the man barged into the hall, doused himself in fuel and lit himself with a matchstick, police said. He died during treatment on Sunday, police added.

41.title: I'm very happy making films: Akshay on if he's planning to join politics
41.article_body: Akshay Kumar, when asked if he's planning to join politics, said, "I am very happy making films." "As an actor, I do whatever possible to take up social issues," he added. "I have produced 150 films, the one nearest to my heart is 'Raksha Bandhan'. I produce commercial films, sometimes with social issues," Akshay further said.

42.title: South Korea's inflation touches 24-year high in June
42.article_body: South Korea's inflation rate reached a nearly 24-year high in June amid soaring energy and food prices. The Consumer Price Index rose 6% in June over a year earlier, the highest level since November 1998 during the Asian financial crisis. The CPI rose in almost every sector, with petrochemicals jumping 39.6% and the restaurants sector surging 8%.

43.title: Very heavy and extremely heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
43.article_body: The IMD has issued very heavy and extremely heavy rainfall warning for several states over next few days. Very heavy rainfall is very likely over Gujarat from July 7 to 9. It is very likely over Goa, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh and Odisha until July 9. Extremely heavy rainfall is likely over Gujarat, Maharashtra and Goa on July 7 and 8.

44.title: How have Indian cities ranked on the Global Liveability Index?
44.article_body: New Delhi received the top rank among Indian cities as it ranked 140 (score 56.5) on the Global Liveability Index 2022 released by the Economist Intelligence Unit. New Delhi was followed by Mumbai at 141 (score 56.2), Chennai at 142 (score 55.8), Ahmedabad at 143 (score 55.7) and Bengaluru at 146 (score 54.4). The ideal score is 100.

45.title: Undemocratic, unethical: Mamata on Eknath Shinde govt in Maharashtra
45.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the newly formed Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government and called it "undemocratic" and "unethical". "His government will also not run for long. The BJP uses money power and muscle power along with agencies to go against electoral mandates," Mamata added. They might have formed government, but they have not won people's hearts, Mamata further said.

46.title: 18 killed during protests in Karakalpakstan: Uzbekistan govt
46.article_body: As many as 18 people were killed and 243 wounded during protests in Uzbekistan's autonomous Karakalpakstan province, said the authorities on Monday. The protests were triggered following reports saying the new constitutional amendments would curtail the province's autonomy by snatching its right to secede. The opposition leaders reportedly said that thousands of people had been hospitalised.

47.title: Won't stop fighting gun violence epidemic: Biden after July 4 shooting
47.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden expressed shock over the "senseless" shooting that killed at least six people during an Independence Day Parade. "I'm not going to give up fighting the epidemic of gun violence," Biden said, noting he'd recently signed the first significant gun control measures in decades into law but that "much more work" remains.

48.title: Man Utd can sign Neymar or Lewandowski if Ronaldo leaves: Reports
48.article_body: Manchester United can reportedly sign Paris Saint-Germain's Neymar or Bayern Munich's Robert Lewandowski if their forward Cristiano Ronaldo leaves the club. Notably, Bayern Munich and Italy's Napoli club are interested in signing Ronaldo, reports said. Manchester United is reportedly open to letting Ronaldo go to a non-English club if they are willing to take him on his £500,000-per-week contract.

49.title: Nadal defeats Botic to enter Wimbledon quarters for 8th time
49.article_body: Rafael Nadal reached his eighth Wimbledon quarter-finals after defeating Botic van de Zandschulp 6-4, 6-2, 7-6(8-6) in his fourth-round match. "Wimbledon is a tournament that I like so much. Have been three years without playing here...it means a lot for me," said Nadal. The 36-year-old had lost to Roger Federer in the 2019 semi-finals in his last appearance at Wimbledon.

50.title: When CM Yogi can establish peace in UP, why can’t Gehlot?: Ex-Rajasthan CM
50.article_body: Following the Udaipur murder incident, former Rajasthan Chief Minister Vasundhara Raje on Monday said a sense of fear and insecurity has arisen in the state which should be eliminated. "When Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath can establish peace in Uttar Pradesh by eliminating any atmosphere of terror, why can Ashok Gehlot not do it here?" Raje asked.

51.title: Govt lists Bihar, Andhra as states with emerging startup ecosystem
51.article_body: The third edition of the States' Startup Ranking of 2021 clubbed Andhra Pradesh and Bihar from the States category and Mizoram and Ladakh from the UTs/NE States under the 'Emerging Startup Ecosystem' category. Chhattisgarh, Delhi, Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan were declared 'Aspiring Leaders' among the states. Gujarat and Karnataka emerged as the best performers.

52.title: Avatar 4 is a corker, a mother****er, hope I can make it: Cameron
52.article_body: Director James Cameron said the fourth part of the 'Avatar' film franchise is a "corker" and a "mother****er", adding he hopes he gets to make it. "The 'Avatar' films...are...all-consuming," stated Cameron. Cameron has directed 'Avatar: The Way of Water', which will release on December 16, 2022, having directed the original film 'Avatar' which is one of the highest-grossing movies ever.

53.title: Man held for writing pro-Khalistan slogans on H'yana school, college walls
53.article_body: The police said on Monday that they arrested a man who allegedly wrote pro-Khalistan slogans on the walls of a college and a school in Haryana's Karnal last month. The accused and another person were promised $1,000 (nearly ₹79,000) to do so by a US-based man who contacted them via WhatsApp, police added. The other suspect is still at large.

54.title: 50,000 asked to evacuate as flood situation worsens in Australia
54.article_body: Around 50,000 residents were asked to evacuate in Australia's New South Wales on Tuesday as the flood situation in the region worsened. Several flood rescue operations, supported by the army, were carried out in Sydney. Around 19,000 homes were left without power. The administration has asked people to not leave their houses unless really needed.

55.title: Former B'luru DC arrested on bribery charges in land dispute case
55.article_body: Former Deputy Commissioner of Bengaluru city, J Manjunath, was arrested by the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) on Monday on bribery charges in connection with a land dispute case. He is accused of accepting bribe for passing an order in favour of a complainant over ownership of 38 acres of land in Kudlu village. Two officials were earlier arrested in the case.

56.title: CM Shivraj Chouhan shares video playing badminton after election campaign
56.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan shared a video on Twitter in which he is seen playing badminton in Bhopal's Bhojpur Club. "When I got some time off from the election campaign, I enjoyed badminton...It felt like childhood had returned," he tweeted. The video came as Chouhan took a break after conducting roadshows and several public meetings on Monday.

57.title: Maha CM Eknath Shinde holds meeting with officials amid Mumbai rains
57.article_body: Amid heavy rains in Mumbai and parts of Maharashtra, CM Eknath Shinde held a meeting and directed officials to keep a vigil and ensure that National Disaster Response Force squads are ready. CM is reviewing the situation, considering the warning of torrential rains in the next few days, Maharashtra CMO said. Mumbai recorded 95.81 mm of rainfall in 12 hours.

58.title: Chinese real estate firms take watermelons as down payment amid market slump
58.article_body: Amid a property market slump, Chinese real estate companies have started accepting down payments for houses in watermelon, garlic and other agricultural produce. A developer was reportedly allowing buyers to buy homes using watermelon at a rate of 20 yuan per kilogram. As per analysts, property sales in China dropped by 25% from January to June due to COVID-19 restrictions.

59.title: Suspect who shot & killed 3 in Danish mall remanded in psychiatric ward
59.article_body: A 22-year-old Danish man accused of killing three people and injuring several others during a shooting at a shopping mall in Copenhagen has been remanded into a closed psychiatric care facility for 24 days. The suspect has been charged with manslaughter and intent to kill. Two Danish teens, aged 17, and a 47-year-old Russian were killed in the attack.

60.title: India reports 13,086 new COVID-19 cases, 19 deaths in 24 hours
60.article_body: India has reported 13,086 COVID-19 cases, 12,456 recoveries and 19 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,135 cases and 24 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,14,475, while the death toll reached 5,25,242.

61.title: NZ male and female cricketers to receive equal pay in historic 5-year deal, list released
61.article_body: New Zealand Cricket and the players' association have signed a historic five-year deal that will see male and female cricketers receive equal pay. The match fees for a Test will be NZ$10,250, while it'll be NZ$2,500 for a T20I and NZ$4,000 for an ODI. The new agreement also increases the number of contracts offered to women cricketers in New Zealand.

62.title: Remove criminals from politics: Allahabad HC to Parliament, ECI
62.article_body: The Lucknow bench of Allahabad High Court has asked the Parliament and the Election Commission of India (ECI) to take steps to "remove criminals from politics" and break "unholy alliance" between organised crime, politicians and bureaucrats. "No one can dispute that the present-day politics is caught in crime, identity, patronage, muscle and money network," the bench said.

63.title: Video shows the moment police arrested US Independence Day parade shooting suspect
63.article_body: A video showing the moment police arrested the US Independence Day parade shooting suspect has surfaced on social media. Police arrested 22-year-old Robert Crimo after six people were killed in the shooting in Chicago's Highland Park. "Do me a favour, get on your knees...lay down flat on your stomach," an officer can be heard saying in the video.

64.title: Mumbai faces waterlogging as heavy rains lash city, Maha deploys NDRF teams
64.article_body: Several parts of Mumbai witnessed waterlogging as heavy rains lashed the city on Monday. News agency ANI said that areas including Sion in Mumbai and Khandeshwar Railway Station in Navi Mumbai witnessed waterlogging after rains. Reports also said that NDRF teams have been deployed in Maharashtra as a precautionary measure.

65.title: Wanted to hit Jadeja for 6 from 1st ball: Alex Lees on his 56(46) vs India
65.article_body: England opener Alex Lees has said he wanted to attack India's Ravindra Jadeja in his second innings on Day 4 in the ongoing Test. "If I am honest, I wanted to hit Jadeja for six first ball but yorked myself...I tried to hit the ball where the fielders weren't," he stated. Lees got run-out after scoring a 46-ball 56.

66.title: 12,000 workers fired in Indian startup ecosystem in 2022: Report
66.article_body: More than 12,000 employees in the Indian startup ecosystem and over 22,000 employees in the sector have lost their jobs in 2022, Crunchbase reported. Several major startups, including BYJU'S and Unacademy, have fired employees amid a funding winter. India is expected to see over 60,000 job losses in 2022 alone, led by edtech and e-commerce platforms.

67.title: MSEDCL flying squad uncovers power theft worth ₹98 lakh in Pune
67.article_body: A case has been filed after the Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) flying squad uncovered power theft worth ₹98 lakh in Pune's Ravet. The matter came to light during surprise inspections carried out by an MSEDCL team. A builder allegedly used 2,04,292 units of electricity over 18 months by illegally manipulating the electricity meter using a remote control.

68.title: IMD issues orange alert for next 5 days in Mumbai
68.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued orange weather alert for the next five days in Mumbai. "An orange alert has been declared as a monsoon trough is currently active in this area, resulting in strong winds," IMD official KS Hosalikar said. Everyone should refer to 'Nowcast warnings' section on the IMD website every three hours for updates, he added.

69.title: It's a lot easier to play a villain than it is to play a hero: Bale on Gorr
69.article_body: Actor Christian Bale has said it was a "pleasure" playing Gorr in the upcoming Marvel Studios' 'Thor: Love and Thunder'. "It's a lot easier to play a villain than it is to play a hero," said Bale, who played the titular role in Christopher Nolan's 'Batman' franchise. "Everyone is fascinated with bad guys immediately," Bale further said.

70.title: Man arrested for killing fisherman at Mumbai's Girgaon Chowpatty
70.article_body: A 23-year-old man was arrested for allegedly killing a fisherman at Girgaon Chowpatty in Mumbai last month. The accused, Suraj Yadav, had allegedly smashed the victim's, Gajannan Pawar, head with a stone following an argument, police said. Notably, Yadav had escaped to Mumbai after committing the murder of another man in a similar manner in Goa in March, police added.

71.title: SUV hits 33-yr-old woman in Delhi's Connaught Place; critical
71.article_body: A 33-year-old woman was seriously injured after an SUV hit her while she was on her way to work in Delhi's Connaught Place on Sunday morning. She swung in the air and dropped on the road nearly six feet away after being hit by the vehicle, an eye-witness told police. The woman has been hospitalised and is severely critical.

72.title: 3 drug peddlers arrested in Hyderabad; 30 grams of MDMA seized
72.article_body: The Hyderabad Narcotic Enforcement Wing (H-NEW) along with SR Nagar Police on Monday arrested three drug peddlers. Police also seized 30 grams of MDMA and two cell phones worth ₹3 lakh from their possession. The apprehended persons along with the seized material were handed over to the station house officer of SR Nagar police station for further investigation, police said.

73.title: Eiffel Tower is in a poor state, needs repair to fix rusting issues: Reports
73.article_body: The Eiffel Tower is riddled with rust and requires repair work, as per reports. Among the most visited tourist sites in the world, reports suggest that the monument is in a poor state. It is currently undergoing a repaint for the 2024 Olympic Games in Paris, which costs €60 million. Notably, this is the 20th time it is being repainted.

74.title: We are not traitors, we revolted: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde
74.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Monday said, "We are not traitors, we revolted (against the leadership) because of what was happening." "The one who orchestrated everything is here," Shinde said, pointing to Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis. "I didn’t force anyone to come with me. Nobody put a gun to anyone’s head," Shinde stated.

75.title: Former ADGP Amrit Paul arrested in Karnataka PSI recruitment scam case
75.article_body: Criminal Investigation Department arrested former Additional Director General of Police (ADGP), Amrit Paul, in Bengaluru in connection with the 2021 Karnataka police sub-inspectors (PSI) recruitment scam. He has been sent to police custody for 10 days. Paul was the head of police recruitment cell when the scam broke out in which OMR sheets were allegedly tampered with in the office.

76.title: Maha CM Eknath Shinde recalls losing 2 kids, breaks down in Assembly
76.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde broke down while speaking in the state assembly on Monday. He remembered his family and said, "While I was working as a Shiv Sena Corporator in Thane, I lost two of my children and thought everything is over...I was broken but Anand Dighe Sahab convinced me to continue in politics."

77.title: Ukraine needs $750 bn to rebuild country: PM Shmyhal
77.article_body: Ukrainian PM Denys Shmyhal has said it will cost an estimated $750 billion to rebuild the war-shattered country. "We believe that the key source of recovery should be the confiscated assets of Russia and Russian oligarchs," Shmyhal added. "The reconstruction of Ukraine is not a local project...but a common task of the entire democratic world," Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said.

78.title: We could've batted England out of the game, but we couldn't: Vikram Rathour
78.article_body: With England needing 119 runs on the final day to win the ongoing rescheduled fifth Test, India batting coach Vikram Rathour has said they could've done better in their second innings and put England out of the game. "We could've batted England out of the game, but we couldn't. We should've shown better strategy as a batting unit," he stated.

79.title: Samsung Electronics to invest $500 million in Mexico
79.article_body: Mexican Foreign Minister Marcelo Ebrard has said that Samsung Electronics will invest $500 million in Mexico to increase the production of home appliances in the country. He took to Twitter to announce that the firm will invest in the northern border city of Tijuana and Queretaro in central Mexico. He added that he had met with Samsung's CEO Han Jong-Hee.

80.title: Civic workers in Bengaluru end protest over permanent jobs
80.article_body: Civic workers (pourakarmikas) in Bengaluru, who were protesting for four days demanding their jobs be converted from contractual to permanent basis, called off the strike on Monday. The stir ended after the Karnataka government asked a newly-formed committee to look into their demands. A protester said they have been working for 20 years but still not made permanent.

81.title: Umpire heard angrily telling Stuart Broad to shut up on stump mic, video surfaces
81.article_body: Umpire Richard Kettleborough was heard angrily telling England's Stuart Broad to shut up on stump mic during the rescheduled fifth Test against India. Broad was seen remonstrating with the umpire after facing bouncers, following which Kettleborough said, "Let us do the umpiring...you do the batting...alright? Otherwise...you're going to get into trouble again...Get on with batting and shut up."

82.title: Indian fans allegedly suffer racist abuse during India-England Test, investigation on
82.article_body: Several Indian fans have alleged that they suffered racist abuse in the stands at Edgbaston during India's rescheduled fifth Test against England. "We reported it to the stewards and showed them the culprits at least 10 times, but no response," one of the fans tweeted. The England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) later said that they are investigating the matter.

83.title: Virat Kohli's aggressive celebration after Lees' wicket goes viral, fans react
83.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli's aggressive celebration after opener Alex Lees' wicket in England's second innings of the Edgbaston Test has gone viral. Kohli was seen making a celebratory run towards departing Lees, roaring and punching in the air. "He is the life of Test cricket," a fan commented. "This Kohli is much better than the quiet one," wrote another.

84.title: UP man sells chicken on paper with photo of Hindu god, goddess; arrested
84.article_body: A man named Talib Hussain was arrested in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh for allegedly hurting religious sentiments by selling chicken on a piece of paper carrying a picture of a Hindu god and goddess and also attacking a police team. When a police team reached his shop, Hussain attacked them with a knife with an intention to kill, the FIR said.

85.title: Police arrest suspect after 6 killed in US Independence Day parade shooting
85.article_body: Police announced they have captured a suspect after six people were killed and more than 36 were wounded in a shooting during a US Independence Day parade in the Chicago suburb of Highland Park. Police said they captured 22-year-old Robert Crimo. The shooting took place from rooftop of a business that the gunman reached via an alley ladder, police said.

86.title: Nobody is kind when you aren't saleable: Actor Zayed Khan on B'wood
86.article_body: Actor Zayed Khan, who featured in Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Main Hoon Na', said "nobody is kind" to you in Bollywood when you are not saleable. "Success is like an accident you have to survive...You have to grow thick skin," added Zayed. Talking about his ex-brother-in-law, actor Hrithik Roshan, Zayed stated, "I love him from the bottom of my heart."

87.title: Now ED's target won't be Maha but other states like Chhattisgarh: Baghel
87.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said that now target of central agencies like ED and CBI won't be Maharashtra but they all will become active in Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, West Bengal, Rajasthan or southern states. "In the last eight years of the Modi govt, there haven't been proceedings on a single BJP-ruled state. This is a misuse of government agencies," he added.

88.title: Boy kidnapped for ₹20 lakh ransom rescued within 6 hours: Pune Police
88.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Police said that they rescued a 15-year-old boy six hours after he was allegedly kidnapped for a ransom of ₹20 lakh on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday. Police arrested three men and detained two minors in connection with the case. "A probe revealed the accused had known that boy's family had three food stalls," police added.

89.title: 24-year-old man kills father using scissors after argument in Hyd
89.article_body: A 24-year-old man was taken into custody by the police after he allegedly killed his father using scissors following an argument over a minor issue in Hyderabad's Golconda. The accused, who is unemployed and a habitual alcoholic, used to get into altercations with his parents frequently, according to the police. The accused's mother filed a complaint in the matter.

90.title: Series of earthquakes hit Andaman and Nicobar Islands
90.article_body: A series of earthquakes hit the Andaman and Nicobar Islands on July 5, according to the National Center for Seismology. The strongest tremor, marked 5.0 on the Richter scale, was recorded at 5:57 am on Tuesday. An earthquake of 4.4-magnitude hit the islands at 2:54 am today, while a 4.5-magnitude tremor was recorded at 1:30 am.

91.title: Centre shuffling Delhi officers like deck of cards: Dy CM Manish Sisodia
91.article_body: The Centre is shuffling Delhi officers like a deck of cards, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said. "Centre is playing with future of Delhi's six lakh children...after unconstitutionally snatching away Arvind Kejriwal-led government's services department," he added. Since 2018, nine principal secretaries and seven directors of Delhi's Department of Training and Technical Education have been transferred.

92.title: Took us 1 yr 4 months to make Shamshera set, 2.5 yrs for VFX: Director Karan
92.article_body: 'Shamshera' director Karan Malhotra said that film's set construction took one year and four months. "[It took] 500+ workers along with crew members of setting department, 140 days of shoot and it took 2.5 years for us to work on our VFX to bring 'Shamshera' in its finest glory to our audiences," he added.

93.title: Man says he works in PM's office, seeks tourist arrangements; booked in K'taka
93.article_body: The Karnataka police have booked an unidentified man who allegedly sought tourist arrangements in the state by claiming that he works in the Prime Minister's Office. A complaint filed in the case said that the person sought arrangements for staying at a resort, a jungle safari, arrangements to visit a temple and viewing of a rare-flowering tree in the region.

94.title: IAS officer shares pics of book he used for UPSC preparation, calls it his 'favourite'
94.article_body: IAS officer Awanish Sharan on Monday shared pictures of a book he used for UPSC preparation and wrote, "My brother shared the pages of my favourite book during UPSC preparation." Pictures showed heavily marked pages of the book titled 'The Wonder That Was India' by AL Basham. "Hard work always pays off," a Twitter user reacted to his post.

95.title: Shireen Akleh likely killed by unintentional Israeli gunfire: US
95.article_body: After summarising investigations by the Israeli and Palestinian sides, the US Security Coordinator has concluded that Palestinian-American journalist Shireen Abu Akleh was likely killed by unintentional gunfire from Israeli positions, the US State Department said Monday. However, the bullet was badly damaged which prevented ballistic experts from reaching a clear conclusion, the department added.

96.title: India need 7 wickets on last day to beat England in rescheduled 5th Test
96.article_body: India need seven wickets on the last day to defeat England in the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston. England ended the fourth day at 259/3 in the second innings, needing another 119 runs to win the match. Earlier in the day, India were dismissed for 245 in their second innings, with Cheteshwar Pujara and Rishabh Pant hitting fifties.

97.title: Chinese-Canadian billionaire due to go on trial in China: Canada
97.article_body: Chinese-Canadian billionaire Xiao Jianhua, who was allegedly detained by Chinese officials from a Hong Kong hotel in 2017, was expected to go on trial in China on Monday, Canada's embassy in Beijing informed. An embassy official read a statement saying, "Consular officials are monitoring this case closely, providing consular services to his family and continue to press for consular access."

98.title: What is happening: Urfi Javed on social media user claiming she is dead
98.article_body: 'Bigg Boss OTT' fame Urfi Javed reacted to a post claiming she has died in a now-deleted post on Instagram Stories. She wrote, "What is happening in this world? I have been receiving so many death threats and now this! The comment says they stand with my murderer!" The post read, "RIP Urfi Javed a big loss for [no one]."

99.title: PM Modi to visit Varanasi on July 7, inaugurate multiple projects
99.article_body: PM Modi will visit Varanasi on July 7 where he will inaugurate and lay the foundation stone for multiple projects worth ₹1,800 crore at the Dr Sampurnanand Sports Stadium, as per the PMO. He will also inaugurate the Akshay Patra Mid-Day Meal Kitchen at LT College with a capacity of cooking mid-day meals for around one lakh students.

100.title: My abortion saved my life: Halsey pens open letter on US SC's abortion ruling
100.article_body: Singer Halsey has written an open letter in Vogue following the US Supreme Court's decision to overturn the landmark ruling which granted women abortion rights. Halsey wrote, "My abortion saved my life and gave way for my son to have his." She further wrote she had three miscarriages before turning 24, one of which required abortion to avoid risking sepsis.

101.title: Kyrgios reaches quarters at Wimbledon for the first time in 8 years
101.article_body: Unseeded Nick Kyrgios reached the quarter-final at Wimbledon for the first time in eight years following a 4-6, 6-4, 7-6(7-2), 3-6, 6-2 win against American Brandon Nakashima on Monday. "It wasn't near my best performance, level wise but I'm just super, super happy to get through," said Kyrgios. The 27-year-old won the fourth round match in three hours 11 minutes.

102.title: Anupam Kher gets injured on sets while shooting for Kaagaz 2: Reports
102.article_body: Anupam Kher, who's shooting for 'Kaagaz 2', reportedly got injured on the set of the film, but after taking a brief break, the actor resumed work the very same day. According to reports, it was an intense courtroom scene and Kher hit his head on table. Reports added it wasn't that serious. He was injured but there was no bleeding.

103.title: Tesla sued by Black employees over racial discrimination in US
103.article_body: Tesla is facing a mass action lawsuit from 15 current and former Black employees who have alleged that the company operates under a "pre-Civil Rights" atmosphere. The lawsuit, filed in a California court, claimed that employees faced racial harassment at Tesla factories which transformed into a hostile work environment. The complaint included allegations of derogatory language used by supervisors.

104.title: Kazakhstan's Rybakina beats Martic to enter maiden Wimbledon quarters
104.article_body: Kazakhstan's Elena Rybakina entered her first Wimbledon quarter-final after defeating unseeded Croatian Petra Martic 7-5, 6-3 in one hour 20 minutes on Monday. "It means a lot to me (to be in the quarter-final)," said Rybakina. The 17th seed hit 26 winners to Martic's 13 in fourth round. Notably,  Rybakina hasn't dropped a set during her run to the quarter-final.

105.title: Activist Sharjeel Imam claims he was assaulted in jail, called 'terrorist'
105.article_body: Activist Sharjeel Imam, who is in judicial custody in connection with the Northeast Delhi riots, on Monday moved a city court and claimed he was assaulted by convicts at Tihar Jail. He added that he was allegedly called a "terrorist" and "anti-national" during an "illegal search" inside his cell. Imam also claimed there was threat to his life in prison.

106.title: Several people shot during Independence Day parade in US
106.article_body: An active shooting situation has been reported from an Independence Day parade in Illinois in the US with reports saying that multiple people are believed to have been injured. At least one person was feared dead, Reuters reported, quoting local media. The incident was reported in the wealthy Highland Park suburb of Chicago.

107.title: Kangana appears before court, pleads not guilty in Javed's defamation case
107.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut appeared before the court of the metropolitan magistrate in Mumbai's Andheri and pleaded not guilty in the defamation case filed by lyricist Javed Akhtar. The actress also asked for the trial to proceed behind closed doors as she doesn't want a "media trial". This is Kangana's third appearance before court since the case was filed in 2020.

108.title: Israel & Poland to restore ties after Holocaust restitution row
108.article_body: Israel and Poland have agreed to restore ties that became strained after Warsaw introduced a law in 2021 limiting ability of Jews to recover World War Two properties. The countries have mutually decided to restore their respective ambassadors. "Both presidents expressed...hope that any future issues...will be solved through sincere and open dialogue," a statement issued by Israeli President read.

109.title: China urges Myanmar military junta to hold talks with opponents
109.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi during his Myanmar visit urged the country's military junta to hold talks with its opponents and "realise political reconciliation". A read-out of Wang's remarks released by his ministry read, "China expects all parties in Myanmar to prioritise the big picture and the interests of the people... and realise...lasting peace and stability at an early date."

110.title: Garin enters 1st Grand Slam quarters after 4-hour 34-minute win at Wimbledon
110.article_body: World number 43 Cristian Garin came back from two sets and 3-0 down to complete a 2-6, 5-7, 7-6(7-3), 6-4, 7-6(10-6) win against the 19th seed Alex De Minaur to reach his first Grand Slam quarter-final at Wimbledon on Monday. The Chilean saved two match points during his four-hour 34-minute win in the fourth round.

111.title: Disqualification notices sent to Uddhav camp's MLAs except Aaditya Thackeray
111.article_body: Shiv Sena chief whip Bharat Gogawale of Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's camp on Monday said they have sent disqualification notices to all the MLAs of the Uddhav Thackeray faction for defying their whip during the floor test. However, Gogawale said they haven't sent notice to Aaditya Thackeray due to their respect for Balasaheb Thackeray.

112.title: Turkish court refuses to extradite suspect in Haiti Prez's killing
112.article_body: A Turkish court on Monday rejected request to extradite a man to Haiti over his alleged involvement in the assassination of President Jovenel Moise. The accused, Samir Handal, was detained in Turkey on an Interpol red notice while he was transiting the country to reach Jordan from US last year. Moise was shot dead at his residence in July 2021.

113.title: Man who entered CM Mamata's house says he thought it was Kolkata Police HQ
113.article_body: A man, who was arrested for allegedly entering the premises of West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's residence after crossing over a wall late at night, told police he did so thinking it was the Kolkata Police headquarters. "He couldn't give any proper reply when asked why he wanted to go to police headquarters at that hour," a police officer said.

114.title: Sana reaches Saudi Arabia with husband for her first Hajj, says 'I'm excited'
114.article_body: Former actress Sana Khan shared a video montage after she reached Saudi Arabia for her first Hajj with her husband Anas Saiyad. Taking to Instagram, Sana shared a video and said, "This is my first Hajj and you can see my eyes are swollen. I'm very...excited of course as this was my dream that God has fulfilled today...It's amazing."

115.title: Happy the way we batted: Harmanpreet on India's 10-wicket win vs SL
115.article_body: India Women skipper Harmanpreet Kaur said she was happy with her side's batting in the 10-wicket win against Sri Lanka Women in second ODI. Smriti Mandhana(94*) and Shafali Verma(71*) added a 174-run partnership for the opening wicket. "We've been talking about long partnerships and thankfully we got it today...it was outstanding to watch," she added. India lead three-match series 2-0.

116.title: Will visit Guj every week, address issues: Kejriwal ahead of polls
116.article_body: Ahead of Assembly elections in Gujarat, AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that he will visit the state every week and discuss various issues with residents. Kejriwal made these remarks at a meeting organised on the issue of electricity in Gujarat. He added that the state will get free electricity up to 200 units if AAP is elected.

117.title: Neha Dhupia felicitated at Miss India to mark 20 years of her win
117.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia was felicitated at the 2022 Femina Miss India finale by her parents to mark 20 years since she won the title in 2002. Neha was also joined on stage by her husband Angad Bedi and their two children. The Miss India Instagram page shared pictures, writing, "Thank you Neha Dhupia, for being...a mentor to our ladies."

118.title: I wanted to run away in the first year of my marriage: Farah Khan
118.article_body: Choreographer-filmmaker Farah Khan made an appearance at 'Swayamvar-Mika Di Vohti'. Speaking about singer Mika, Farah said, "Mika is a very sensitive person, only a sorted girl can handle him. I feel...you should marry when you find the right person." Sharing her own experience, she said, "I wanted to run away in the first year of my marriage."

119.title: Gauri Lankesh's murder trial begins in Bengaluru court
119.article_body: Almost five years after she was murdered, journalist and activist Gauri Lankesh's murder trial began at a Bengaluru sessions court. The 55-year-old editor of Lankesh Patrike was shot dead outside her home in September 2017. Of the 18 accused, 17 have been arrested, and the court will hear the matter for five days during the second week of every month.

120.title: Maha state power discom removes 5 meter-reading agencies
120.article_body: Maharashtra's state power distribution company MSEDCL has terminated the services of five private meter-reading agencies after finding negligence in taking the readings, the company said Monday. It added, "Three agencies are from Solapur district, while two are from Pune district." All electric meter-reading agencies are currently under scrutiny from MSEDCL following complaints of discrepancies.

121.title: Payments startup slice appoints Sudeep Behari as its Business Head
121.article_body: Payments startup slice has appointed Sudeep Behari as its new Business Head. With Behari having more than 16 years of experience in the credit finance industry, slice said that the decision was taken with the aim of expanding the company's services to a wider audience. Prior to joining slice, Behari was leading the ICICI-Amazon credit card partnership.

122.title: Crypto exchanges' trading volume falls by 70% in 3 days as TDS rule takes effect
122.article_body: Trading volumes on Indian cryptocurrency exchanges declined by at least 70% in three days after the new rule requiring 1% tax deduction at source on every transaction came into effect on July 1. Trading volumes on WazirX were down the most at 82%, as per data from Crebaco. Meanwhile, ZebPay and CoinDCX saw a decline of 76% and 70%, respectively.

123.title: Wore 8-9 pairs of black jeans for song Duniya Haseenon Ka Mela: Bobby
123.article_body: As Bobby Deol-starrer 'Gupt' completed 25 years, the actor recalled shooting for his song 'Duniya Haseenon Ka Mela'. He said, "I would rehearse so much that I was drenched in sweat by the end of it." "And then white patches would be visible because of it. I wore eight-nine pairs of black jeans for that one song," he added.

124.title: India Women record their highest stand vs SL Women in ODIs, win series
124.article_body: Smriti Mandhana and Shafali Verma's 174-run first wicket partnership helped India Women beat Sri Lanka Women by 10 wickets in second ODI in Pallekele to take a 2-0 lead and win the three-match series. Notably, it's India's highest partnership for any wicket against the hosts in ODIs. Smriti's 94* and Shafali's 71* helped the visitors chase 174 in 25.4 overs.

125.title: Dead man wins sarpanch polls in MP, authorities look for solution
125.article_body: A deceased man has won sarpanch elections in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district. The man, Ravindra Thakur, passed away due to cardiac arrest on June 22, but his name appeared on ballot papers for July 1 polls as authorities weren't informed, an official said. "We've sought the opinion of the state election commission," Sagar Collector Deepak Arya said.

126.title: Tripura CM Manik Saha to take oath as MLA on July 8
126.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha will take oath as MLA on July 8, Tripura Assembly speaker said on Monday. He added that Saha met Rajya Sabha chairman and Vice President, M Venkaiah Naidu, to tender his resignation as Rajya Sabha MP on Monday. Saha had won the by-election from Town Bardowali assembly seat, after assuming office as CM on May 14.

127.title: Media landscape has changed in past few years: Thakur
127.article_body: BJP leader Anurag Thakur on Monday said that the media landscape has changed in the past few years and the emergence of digital media has made information accessible. However, he cautioned against the challenges, including the spread of misinformation and competition for traditional mediums. COVID-19 pandemic became infodemic and this problem arose globally, Thakur added.

128.title: Video shows Sidhu Moosewala's shooters waving guns, celebrating in car
128.article_body: A video showing shooters accused of killing singer Sidhu Moosewala waving guns and celebrating in a car is being widely shared on social media. The video was reportedly found on a phone of one of the accused shooters. The shooters in the video are Ankit Sirsa, Priyavrat, Kapil, Sachin Bhivani and Deepak, according to ANI.

129.title: Was suppressed for long time; won't resort to vendetta politics: Shinde
129.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Monday said that the rebellion led by him was a fallout of the unfair treatment meted out to him, but added that he won't resort to vendetta politics. "I alone had closed down 16 ladies' bars in and around Thane. There are some 100 various criminal charges registered against me," he said.

130.title: India has eliminated all queues by going online: PM at Digital India Week
130.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, speaking at Digital India Week 2022 in Gujarat, on Monday said, "India has eliminated all queues by going online." "Eight to 10 years ago, we had to stand in queues...to pay bills, for ration, for admission, for exam results, in banks," he added. "Government's Digital India programme has given relief to poor from corruption," the PM said.

131.title: Don't make us seek an independent Tamil Nadu: DMK's A Raja
131.article_body: DMK MP A Raja on Monday demanded that Centre should grant 'state autonomy' to Tamil Nadu and not push party to seek an independent country. Raja, who made these remarks while addressing party's local body representatives in Namakkal, said that DMK won't rest until demand is fulfilled. Meanwhile, fellow party leader TKS Elangovan said that Raja made comments in "frustration".

132.title: Few focused on why there's Modi's pic on vaccination certificates: PM
132.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday criticised Opposition leaders who questioned his picture on COVID-19 vaccination certificates. "The world is discussing how we managed to give COVID-19 vaccination certificates to people just after they got jabbed, but few people were focused on why is there Modi's photo on these certificates," he said. PM Modi was speaking in Gujarat.

133.title: India issues statement, asks Canada to remove film poster showing goddess Kali smoking
133.article_body: Amid controversy over Leena Manimekalai's documentary film Kaali's poster, which shows the goddess smoking, the Indian High Commission has issued a statement saying they've urged the Canadian authorities to withdraw all provocative material. India said it received several complaints. Manimekalai had tweeted the poster while informing about the documentary's screening at Toronto's Aga Khan Museum.

134.title: Salman Khan to launch Yo Yo Honey Singh in Bollywood: Reports
134.article_body: Actor Salman Khan will reportedly launch singer Yo Yo Honey Singh in Bollywood. According to reports, the rapper will be seen in Salman's forthcoming film 'Bhaijaan'. As per reports, Salman has given the responsibility of songs for the film to Honey and Devi Sri Prasad. The project marks Honey Singh’s first collaboration with Devi Sri Prasad, reports added.

135.title: BJP uses criminal elements for its own propaganda: Mehbooba Mufti
135.article_body: PDP President Mehbooba Mufti alleged that the BJP is using criminal elements to perpetuate its propaganda of "communal division and hatred." Referring to media reports claiming that the murderer of the Udaipur tailor, and an LeT terrorist arrested from Jammu had links to the BJP, she said that had these been associated with Opposition leaders, multiple FIRs would be filed.

136.title: Andhra minister requests PM Modi, CM for selfie at event; video surfaces
136.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi addressed a public meeting in Andhra Pradesh's Pedamiram on Monday, state Tourism and Culture Minister RK Roja requested him and Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy for a selfie. PM Modi and the CM obliged and posed for a picture. Earlier in the day, PM Modi said Andhra Pradesh is the land of heroes and patriots.

137.title: It was an opportunity to bat all-overs: Powell on his 61* vs Bangladesh
137.article_body: Contributing to his team's 35-run win against Bangladesh in second T20I, West Indies batter Rovman Powell said he took the opportunity to advance the score and bat all-overs. "Platform was already set by captain [Nicholas Pooran] and Brandon King...I think they played well before I got to the crease," he added. Batting at number five, Powell scored a 28-ball 61*.

138.title: Fourth crew member of ship that sank off Hong Kong coast rescued
138.article_body: A fourth crew member of the engineering ship that sank near the coast of Hong Kong on Saturday was rescued on Monday. According to Guangdong maritime authorities, the crew member was rescued by a navy ship and is in stable condition. The China-registered floating crane Fujing 001 sank in the South China Sea after being hit by Typhoon Chaba.

139.title: Ukrainian flag raised on Snake Island after Russian retreat, pic surfaces
139.article_body: The Ukrainian flag has been raised again on Snake Island, days after Ukraine claimed to have driven the Russian forces out of the area. A picture of the flag installed on the island located in the Black Sea has also been shared online by Ukrainian officials. Russia's Snake Island withdrawal could loosen its blockade on Ukrainian ports, experts have said.

140.title: Pant creates record for scoring most runs in an overseas Test by an India wicketkeeper
140.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant has set the record for scoring most runs in an overseas Test by an India wicketkeeper. The 24-year-old set the record by aggregating 203 runs in the rescheduled fifth Test against England at Edgbaston. The previous record was set by Vijay Manjrekar, who had scored 161 runs against West Indies in Kingston, Jamaica in 1953.

141.title: What can consumers do if any hotel or restaurant levies service charge?
141.article_body: Consumers can request hotels or restaurants levying service charge to remove it from the bill amount, the government has said. Consumers can also lodge a complaint on National Consumer Helpline by calling 1915 or through the mobile app. Further, they can file a complaint against unfair trade practice with the Consumer Commission or submit a complaint to the District Collector.

142.title: Amarnath pilgrim critically injured after falling off pony, airlifted by Army
142.article_body: The Indian Army on Monday airlifted a 50-year-old critically injured pilgrim undertaking the Amarnath Yatra from the Brarimarg helipad on Baltal track in Jammu and Kashmir to the nearest medical facility. The man sustained injuries after his pony lost balance and he fell down around 100 feet towards Sindh river, officials said. The pilgrim was returning to the base camp.

143.title: New Maha govt won't last long, many contradictions in it: Cong leader
143.article_body: Congress leader HK Patil on Monday said that the newly-formed Maharashtra government under CM Eknath Shinde "won't last long" as there are too many "contradictions" in it. "Shiv Sena MLAs are restless. The way they have travelled so much shows they are not united," he added. Patil stated that Congress will remain a part of Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA).

144.title: Magnitude 4.4 earthquake hits Andaman & Nicobar Islands
144.article_body: A 4.4 magnitude earthquake had hit the Andaman & Nicobar Islands on Monday, the National Center for Seismology confirmed. According to data provided by the agency, the earthquake's epicentre was located 256 km South-East of Port Blair, at a depth of 10 km. Earlier in the day, a 3.2 magnitude earthquake hit J&K, as per the agency.

145.title: ED attaches 16 properties worth ₹137 crore of B'luru-based real estate firm
145.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Monday said it has provisionally attached 16 immovable properties worth ₹137.60 crore of Bengaluru-based real estate firm Dreamz Infra India Limited in connection with a scam. The scam was exposed in 2017 after police found that at least 5,000 people were cheated of ₹1,500 crore. Three prime accused in the case have already been arrested.

146.title: Video shows Rahul offering food to woman, later hugging her in Kerala
146.article_body: The Congress party has shared a video showing party leader Rahul Gandhi offering food to a woman at an eatery during his visit to Kerala's Wayanad. The video shows Rahul asking his colleague KC Venugopal, "Why can't she sit with us...Does she want tea?" The Congress leaders then offered her food, following which Rahul hugged her.

147.title: NIA chief meets Amit Shah over Udaipur, Amravati killings: Reports
147.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) chief Dinkar Gupta reportedly met Union Home Minister Amit Shah at his office over the two killings in Rajasthan's Udaipur and Maharashtra's Amravati. This comes after the Ministry of Home Affairs directed the NIA to take over the investigation of the two murders. The MHA said that the conspiracy behind the killings would be probed.

148.title: 10,000 female aspirants register for Navy's Agnipath scheme till Sunday
148.article_body: Around 10,000 female aspirants registered themselves for the recruitment of sailors in the Indian Navy under the newly introduced Agnipath scheme till Sunday, according to government officials. The registration process began on Friday. This is the first time that women will be inducted as sailors in the Indian Navy. Online application for recruitment is scheduled to open on July 15.

149.title: SC to hear plea on AIADMK leadership row on July 6
149.article_body: The Supreme Court will hear a plea by former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami on July 6. The plea challenges a Madras High Court order staying the passing of resolutions in AIADMK General Council Meeting. The plea will be heard subject to clearance from Chief Justice NV Ramana, vacation bench of Justices Indira Banerjee and JK Maheshwari said.

150.title: I was first choice for 'Ghajini', but didn't like the story: Madhavan
150.article_body: Actor R Madhavan has revealed that he was the first choice for 2005 Tamil film 'Ghajini' but rejected it because he did not like the story. The role was portrayed by Suriya. "'Ghajini' becoming a hit was a very big thing," the actor added. The film was remade in Hindi in 2008 starring Aamir Khan and Asin.

151.title: Large number of fish found dead in Delhi's Najafgarh drain, samples collected
151.article_body: A large number of fish were found dead in the upstream stretch of Najafgarh drain along Delhi-Haryana border in the last few days. "The number of dead fish could be in lakhs. It could be due to the release of an excessive amount of pollutants," a forest department official said. Water samples from the drain have been collected for testing.

152.title: Bodies of 5 Army personnel killed in Manipur landslide sent to home stations
152.article_body: The mortal remains of five Territorial Army personnel, who were killed in the landslide in Manipur's Noney district, were sent to their respective home stations by an IAF aircraft on Monday. The deceased personnel were accorded full military honours at the Imphal airport by senior Army and Assam Rifles officials. The death toll in the incident has risen to 42.

153.title: SriLankan Airlines' ops to be impacted due to fuel crisis: Report
153.article_body: Sri Lanka's national carrier SriLankan Airlines' flight operations will reportedly be impacted till July 18 due to a crunch in jet fuel supplies amid the country's economic crisis. The airline reportedly ran out of available jet fuel stocks on June 29. Notably, Sri Lanka has barred the sale of fuel, except supplies required for essential services, till July 10.

154.title: What are the highest successful run chases against India in Test cricket history?
154.article_body: India have set a target of 378 runs for England in the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston. The record for the highest successful run chase against India in Test cricket history is held by Australia, who chased down a 339-run target in Perth in 1977. It is followed by target of 276 runs (West Indies) and 240 runs (South Africa).

155.title: Laxman to coach Team India in first T20I against England: Report
155.article_body: Ex-India batter VVS Laxman will reportedly coach Team India in first T20I against England in Southampton. The National Cricket Academy (NCA) Director was appointed as India's head coach in the side's recently concluded two-match T20I series against Ireland. Laxman was given the responsibility because the regular head coach Rahul Dravid was with India in England for the rescheduled fifth Test.

156.title: Reminds me of SpiceJet jeans, kurti uniform: SpiceJet ex-COO on Akasa crew uniform
156.article_body: SpiceJet's former COO Sanjiv Kapoor reacted to the newly-released look of Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air's crew uniform, saying, "Love the sneakers!" Kapoor said, "(It) reminds me of the casual jeans and kurtis weekend uniform we had introduced at SpiceJet in 2014." He added, "Casual and fun works well for low-cost carriers (LCC). Good an Indian LCC will have it now."

157.title: We have a great chemistry: Kriti on working with Kartik in Shehzada
157.article_body: Speaking about working with actor Kartik Aaryan in 'Shehzada', actress Kriti Sanon said it has always been fun to work with him. She added they've great chemistry and their give and take as actors have always been...good. "So it's nice to reunite after Luka Chuppi," she said. Meanwhile, on the work front, Kriti was last seen in 'Bachchhan Paandey'.

158.title: Villagers spot Pakistani drone in Jammu and Kashmir
158.article_body: Villagers in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district claimed to have spotted a Pakistani drone, a police official said. The drone was spotted in Rajpura area along the Indo-Pakistan international border, and the SOG Samba launched a search operation. The search operation used drones to scan but found nothing. This is the second drone sighting in Samba in last one month.

159.title: Who are the 5 new ministers in CM Bhagwant Mann's expanded Cabinet?
159.article_body: Five MLAs were sworn in as ministers in Punjab on Monday as Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann expanded his Cabinet for the first time after forming government in the state. The legislators who took oath are Aman Arora, Dr Inderbir Singh Nijjar, Fauja Singh Sarari, Chetan Singh Jouramajra and Anmol Gagan Mann. The Cabinet now has 15 ministers, including the CM.

160.title: US-headquartered unicorn startup Amagi aims to list in India: Co-founder
160.article_body: New York-headquartered Amagi, a media-tech software-as-a-service (SaaS) unicorn, is aiming to launch its initial public offering (IPO) in India, Co-founder Baskar Subramanian said in an episode of CNN-News18's Bits to Billions. With Amagi's profits growing more than two-fold in FY21, Subramanian said profitability is an addictive phenomenon. Further, he said that frugality helps with innovation.

161.title: Delhi govt installs CCTV cameras at critical water logging points
161.article_body: The Delhi government has installed CCTV cameras at critical water logging points in the city, with an aim of ensuring that they're monitored. According to PWD officials, there will be round-the-clock monitoring of the critical water logging points as the CCTV feed will be sent to the PWD control room from where instructions will be sent to the ground staff.

162.title: PMC receives over 4,000 objections against draft electoral roll
162.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation received 4,273 objections against the draft electoral roll published last month. It had published the draft electoral roll on June 23 and sought suggestions and objections of voters by July 1, which was later pushed to July 3. The PMC stated that only those registered till May 31 this year were included in the electoral roll.

163.title: Australia ends requirement to declare vaccination status for international arrivals
163.article_body: Australia will not require international arrivals to declare their COVID-19 vaccination status from Wednesday (July 6) onwards, the country's government has announced. The restrictions on international arrivals were introduced in 2020 to control the spread of COVID-19. They have been removed now to reduce delays at airports, Australian Home Affairs Minister Clare O'Neil said.

164.title: Alt News' Zubair taken to UP after new FIR over calling seers 'hate mongers'
164.article_body: Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair was brought to Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur by Delhi Police on Monday in connection with a new case registered against him for allegedly hurting religious sentiments. According to the FIR, Zubair had allegedly called Hindu seers Yati Narsinghanand Saraswati, Bajrang Muni, and Anand Swaroop "hate mongers" in his tweet dated May 27.

165.title: Pic shows 19-yr-old shooter Ankit posing with bullets spelling out 'Sidhu Moosewala'
165.article_body: A picture showing 19-year-old shooter Ankit Sirsa posing with bullets spelling out 'Sidhu Moosewala' before the singer was killed has surfaced online. Sirsa was arrested by Delhi Police over Moosewala's murder, with officers saying he was one of the shooters involved in the killing. Police said Sirsa was the "youngest shooter and most desperate" among those who shot Moosewala.

166.title: Madhubala begged Dilip Kumar to apologise to dad, he refused: Madhubala's sister
166.article_body: Madhubala's sister Madhur Bhushan said Madhubala and Dilip Kumar came close to tying the knot but it couldn't happen. "Had the court case not happened, Madhubala would've probably got married to Dilip Kumar. She...urged Dilip saab to apologise to our father," Madhu said. "[She asked him to] say...sorry for the sake of their relationship [but he] refused," she added.

167.title: RBI fines Kotak Mahindra Bank ₹1.05 cr, IndusInd Bank ₹1 cr for non-compliance
167.article_body: The RBI has imposed a monetary penalty of ₹1.05 crore on Kotak Mahindra Bank for not following its directions on customer protection and loans and advances. The bank also failed to credit eligible amount to Depositor Education and Awareness Fund within the prescribed period. Further, IndusInd Bank has been fined ₹1 crore for its failure to adhere to KYC rules.

168.title: Feeling Adivasi woman can't become Prez depicts 'nasty mindset': BJP
168.article_body: BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi on Monday criticised opposition candidate for Presidential polls, Yashwant Sinha, saying a feeling that an Adivasi woman is not capable of the position, depicts one's "nasty mindset". Murmu has already proved her capabilities, as the Governor of Jharkhand, as a minister and MLA in Odisha and as a lecturer in a college, he said.

169.title: Railways starts digital cloakrooms at KSR B'luru City & Cantt stations
169.article_body: The South Western Railway's Bengaluru division has started digital and smart cloakrooms at the KSR Bengaluru City and Bengaluru Cantonment railway stations. This project will generate non-fare revenue, officials said. "Passengers will be able to operate the lockers themselves using the KLOAK app and all operations including payments will be done online," an official stated.

170.title: Amit Shah spoke like broken gramophone at BJP event: T'gana minister
170.article_body: Telangana Finance Minister T Harish Rao on Monday said that Union Home Minister Amit Shah spoke like a "broken gramophone" at BJP's recently-held national executive meeting in Hyderabad. "[BJP leaders] spoke about nothing except getting into power...It was disappointing that they didn't talk about any new welfare development," Rao added. Assembly elections in Telangana will be held in 2023.

171.title: U'khand panel for Uniform Civil Code holds first meeting in Delhi
171.article_body: The first meeting of the five-member draft committee for implementing the Uniform Civil Code in Uttarakhand met for the first time after its formation in May in New Delhi on Monday. The meeting was held under the chairmanship of retired SC Judge Ranjana Desai, who iterated that the second meeting will be held after a week.

172.title: Lost 2 of my kids, thought everything was over: Maha CM as he breaks down in Assembly
172.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde broke down in the state Assembly while remembering his two children who died in a boat tragedy in 2000. He said he was working as a Shiv Sena Corporator in Thane back then. "I lost two of my children and thought everything is over...I was broken but Anand Dighe Sahab convinced me to continue," Shinde said.

173.title: Aditya Chopra to make 2-hero actioner with Salman, SRK: Report
173.article_body: Filmmaker Aditya Chopra is planning to make a two-hero action film featuring Salman Khan and Shah Rukh Khan, reported Pinkvilla. The report quoted a source saying this will be "the first proper two-hero collaboration for the two" since 1995 film 'Karan Arjun'. Salman and Shah Rukh will also be making cameos in each other's upcoming films 'Tiger 3' and 'Pathaan'.

174.title: The best I've ever seen in Tests: De Villiers on Pant-Jadeja's 222-run stand
174.article_body: Sharing his views on the ongoing fifth England-India Test, AB de Villiers said the "counterattack partnership" between Ravindra Jadeja and Rishabh Pant in the first innings is "the best" he has ever seen in Test cricket.
