349.title: Shinde govt may fall in next 6 months, be prepared for mid-term polls: Pawar
349.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that the newly formed Eknath Shinde-led government in Maharashtra is likely to fall in the next six months and everyone should be prepared for mid-term elections in the state. He further added that many rebel MLAs are not happy with the current arrangement and once the ministerial portfolios are distributed, their unrest will come out.

350.title: MCD doubles fines for mosquito breeding at houses, construction sites
350.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi has doubled the fine for mosquito breeding in households, offices and construction sites as well as in containers in home and office spaces. As per the new slab, for residential areas, the fines have been increased to ₹100 per container from ₹50 and for commercial office and educational premises, it has become ₹200 from ₹100.

351.title: Karnataka's 21-year-old Sini Shetty crowned Miss India 2022
351.article_body: Mumbai-born 21-year-old Sini Shetty, who hails from Karnataka, was named Miss India 2022 at the 58th Femina Miss India beauty pageant. Miss India 2020 Manasa Varanasi crowned Sini, who will go on to represent India at the next edition of the Miss World pageant. Meanwhile, 21-year-old Shinata Chauhan was declared the second runner-up and Rubal Shekhawat was named first runner-up.

352.title: Cheteshwar Pujara slams fifty as India lead England by 257 runs after Day 3
352.article_body: India ended the third day of the rescheduled fifth Test at 125/3 in the second innings, leading England by 257 runs. Cheteshwar Pujara is unbeaten on 50*(139), while Rishabh Pant is unbeaten on 30*(46). Earlier in the day, England were dismissed for 284 runs in their first innings, with Mohammed Siraj picking four wickets.

353.title: North Korea criticises US, South Korea, Japan tripartite agreement
353.article_body: Pyongyang has criticised the recent agreement between the US, South Korea and Japan to explore further means of reinforcing "extended deterrence" against North Korea. It said the agreement materialises an alliance like NATO. Pyongyang also said the US is "spreading rumour" about a "threat from North Korea" to gain military supremacy over the Asia-Pacific, North Korean state media reported Sunday.

354.title: Russian ship with stolen Ukrainian wheat held in Turkey: Ukraine
354.article_body: Turkish customs authorities have detained a Russian cargo ship carrying wheat stolen from Ukrainian territory, Ukraine's ambassador to Turkey said on Sunday. He said a future course of action regarding the ship will be reached after a meeting of investigators on Monday. Ukraine had previously asked Turkey to detain the ship, as per documents and an official cited by Reuters.

355.title: Working to fully safeguard US users' data: TikTok to US lawmakers
355.article_body: ByteDance owned TikTok has told US senators that it was working on an agreement to "fully safeguard user data and US national security interests," as per a letter. This comes amid claims that the social media app has leaked US user data to China. TikTok acknowledged that in the past Chinese employees had data access to US user data.

356.title: Twitter banned more than 46,000 accounts in India in May
356.article_body: Twitter banned more than 46,000 accounts of Indian users in May over violation of its guidelines, it said in its monthly compliance report on Sunday. While 43,656 accounts were removed over child sexual exploitation, non-consensual nudity, and similar content, some 2,870 accounts were banned for promoting terrorism. Between April 26 and May 25, Twitter received 1,698 complaints in India.

357.title: 102 people killed in Bangladesh floods so far
357.article_body: The death toll due to the floods in Bangladesh has reached 102, the country's Directorate General of Health Services said. The government agency said that among the deceased, 75 died by drowning, 15 from lightning strikes, two from snake bites, and the rest due to other reasons. The agency said the deaths occurred between May 17 and July 3.

358.title: Pavithra Lokesh claims media representatives stalking her, files complaint
358.article_body: Telugu and Kannada actress Pavithra Lokesh has filed a complaint in Mysuru's VV Puram Police Station claiming that some representatives of the media are stalking her. The actress has stated that they are destroying her peace of mind. She had earlier alleged that fake accounts with her name were made on social media that are making defamatory posts.

359.title: Sainz claims first F1 win at British GP after crash delays the race
359.article_body: Carlos Sainz won first career Formula One race on his 150th start at the British Grand Prix on Sunday. The Ferrari driver beat Red Bull's Sergio Perez and Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton. Part one of the race was red-flagged as Alfa Romeo driver Zhou Guanyu was stretchered off after a major crash on turn one. Championship leader Max Verstappen finished seventh.

360.title: WhatsApp may increase time limit of 'delete for everyone' feature: Report
360.article_body: Meta-owned messaging platform WhatsApp is beta testing the option to increase the time limit for its 'delete for everyone' feature, as per reports. According to WABetaInfo, which offers real-time updates about WhatsApp, the feature has been rolled out for beta testing to a limited number of users. The new limit for the update may be two days and 12 hours.

361.title: Amazon lets Prime users unsubscribe in 2 clicks after EU complaints
361.article_body: The European Commission has said that after complaints from consumer groups, Amazon has made it easier for users to cancel their Prime subscriptions in the region. Users can now unsubscribe with two clicks via a prominent and clear 'cancel button', the Commission said. As per the complaints, users had to earlier go through complicated menus, skewed wording and confusing choices.

362.title: Why is Australia killing millions of honeybees?
362.article_body: Australian authorities have killed over six million honeybees after an outbreak of the deadly varroa mite that was first reported in Sydney last week. The parasitic insect, known to be the biggest threat to bees worldwide, attacks and feeds on honeybees, crippling them and impairing their flight performance. The extermination is being done to save Australia's multimillion-dollar honey industry.

363.title: Don’t blame me: Rohit Shetty on high budget of Khatron Ke Khiladi 12
363.article_body: When asked if he's the reason why the budget of 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12' has increased, filmmaker Rohit Shetty replied, "Don’t blame me. 'Khatron Ke Khiladi' is an expensive show, I think by far one of the most expensive ones." "The scale and quality of the show require that kind of...budget. It has nothing to do with me," he added.

364.title: Sri Lanka struggling to raise $587mn to pay for fuel shipments: Lankan Minister
364.article_body: Sri Lanka needs to pay $587 million for several fuel shipments, said a top minister amid its worst financial crisis and crippling fuel shortage. The country is struggling to raise enough funds to pay for essential imports of items like fuel, food and medicines. Its central bank can supply only about $125 million, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said.

365.title: Madhubala's biopic will not include Kishore Kumar & Dilip Kumar: Madhur
365.article_body: Madhubala's sister Madhur Bhushan said the family wants to celebrate the actor through the biopic. "We are sure that we don’t want to hurt anybody while telling this tale. We don’t want to get into what happened with Dilip Kumar and Kishore Kumar," she added. "They've families, wives and children, too. Every relationship has its ups and downs," she said.

366.title: Two dead as boulder crushes car in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district
366.article_body: A couple was killed on Sunday in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district when a boulder rolled down a hill and crushed the car they were travelling in, police said. The accident took place on the Karnaprayag-Gwaldam national highway, police added. The deceased have been identified as 42-year-old Balbir Singh and his 40-year-old wife Savitri Devi.

367.title: Delhi govt adds Jagannath Puri Yatra under its free pilgrimage scheme
367.article_body: Delhi government will be sending pilgrims for Jagannath Puri Yatra in Odisha under its free pilgrimage scheme, officials said on Sunday. Two trains under the 'Mukhyamantri Tirth Yatra Yojana' will depart for Puri with the pilgrims on July 11 and July 28. The scheme, which was introduced in 2019, was suspended due to the pandemic and resumed in December 2021.

368.title: FPIs withdraw ₹50,203 crore in June, highest net outflow in 2 years
368.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew a net sum of ₹50,203 crore from equities in June, data showed. This is the highest net outflow since March 2020, when they pulled out ₹61,973 crore. Overall, in the first six months of 2022, FPIs pulled out around ₹2.2 lakh crore from domestic equities, which is the highest-ever net withdrawal by them.

369.title: NDMC plans to launch mobile education vans for labourers' children
369.article_body: The New Delhi Municipal Corporation (NDMC) plans to launch mobile school vans to educate labourers' kids and homeless kids. NDMC Vice Chairperson Satish Upadhyay said that before implementation, a feasibility survey will be conducted to identify the number of such students. Lauding Gujarat's 'school on wheels' initiative, he said that they will contact Gujarat education department for ideas.

370.title: HC to hear plea alleging Ram Rahim has been replaced with impostor
370.article_body: The Punjab & Haryana HC will hear a plea on Monday that seeks to "verify the authenticity" of Gurmeet Ram Rahim and ascertain if he has been replaced with an impostor. The petitioners, who have claimed to be followers of Dera Sacha Sauda, have listed multiple changes they claim they have noticed in Ram Rahim's figure and personality.

371.title: JSW Steel to invest ₹10,000cr to reduce carbon footprint: Chairman
371.article_body: JSW Steel has earmarked ₹10,000 crore for investments to reduce its carbon footprint, JSW Group Chairman Sajjan Jindal said. He added that this will be done by increasing the use of renewable energy to replace thermal power and reduce the firm's fuel rate, among others. "We have committed to reducing our CO2 emissions intensity...by 42% by 2030," Jindal said.

372.title: Chip business turnover expected to be around $3.5bn: Vedanta Group
372.article_body: Vedanta Group's global MD of display and semiconductor business Akarsh Hebbar said the firm expects its semiconductor business turnover to be in the range of $3 to $3.5 billion. "This will be from both display and semiconductor combined...We expect $1 billion to come from exports," he added. The firm has earmarked investments of up to $20 billion for the business.

373.title: Four of a family killed in Lakhimpur Kheri as bus hits motorcycle
373.article_body: Four members of a family, including three females, were killed in a road accident in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri on Sunday when a speeding bus hit their motorcycle, police said. The deceased, including a 7-year-old girl, were identified as residents of Dhaurahra village. The bodies have been sent for post-mortem and the driver of the bus has been arrested, police added.

374.title: Health emergency declared in Puducherry district over diarrhoea outbreak
374.article_body: Puducherry's Directorate of Health and Family Welfare Services has declared a public health emergency in Karaikal district, following an outbreak of acute diarrhoea over the last few days. Examination of drinking water samples in the region was found to be not safe for consumption, the  Health Director said. Citizens have been asked to drink boiled water and ensure personal hygiene.

375.title: PM Modi said that Hyderabad is Bhagyanagar: Ravi Shankar Prasad
375.article_body: Speaking about BJP's national executive meet in Hyderabad, BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "PM Modi said that Hyderabad is Bhagyanagar which is significant for all of us." "Sardar Patel kept the foundation of a unified India and now it's BJP's responsibility to carry it further," he added. PM Modi addressed the meet on Sunday.

376.title: I have a dream that once I will do a negative role: Ranbir
376.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor said he once wants to play a negative role. "I've a dream that once I'll do a negative role and people will tell their kids ‘so jaa, so jaa nahi toh Ranbir aa jayega!'" "As our cinema evolves, the villain's character...is becoming complex and interesting. I’m looking forward to the bad guys we're yet to watch," he added.

377.title: Sorry had to kick out British player Watson: Jule on Wimbledon 4th round win
377.article_body: Germany's Jule Niemeier has entered maiden Grand Slam quarter-final on her Wimbledon debut, defeating Great Britain's Heather Watson 6-2, 6-4 in the fourth round on Sunday. "I can't believe it. I want to say sorry I had to kick out a British player today. The atmosphere was incredible," said Niemeier. The 22-year-old will now face compatriot Tatjana Maria.

378.title: Will restrain Centre from destabilising Oppn state govts: Sinha
378.article_body: The Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha has said that he won't hesitate to restrain Centre if it "aids and abets" the destabilisation of state governments run by Opposition parties. "I have declared that I shall speak out against any attempts aimed at communal polarisation...I have also announced that I shall work for the repeal of the sedition law," Sinha added.

379.title: Films don't fail, budgets do; producer shouldn't lose money: Taapsee
379.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu stated that films don't fail but budgets do, adding that it's a universal fact irrespective of whether it's Bollywood or Hollywood. "The most important fact should be that your producers shouldn't be losing money, this is true for an actor and actress," she added. Taapsee further said it is an actor's duty to keep that in mind.

380.title: 34-yr-old mother-of-two Maria enters 1st Slam singles quarters at Wimbledon
380.article_body: Unseeded German Tatjana Maria saved two match points to beat 12th seeded Jelena Ostapenko 5-7, 7-5, 7-5 in the fourth round at Wimbledon and reached her first Grand Slam singles quarter-final on Sunday. Notably, the 34-year-old mother of two, who returned from maternity leave less than a year ago, is the oldest player left in the women's draw.

381.title: Russian scientist dies days after arrest for state treason
381.article_body: A scientist who was arrested from Siberia earlier this week by Russian authorities on charges of state treason has died, his lawyer told Reuters on Sunday. Dmitry Kolker's lawyer said, "He died yesterday. Tomorrow we will lodge a complaint over his detention." Kolker was reportedly suffering from advanced pancreatic cancer. According to Kolker's family, he was detained from a hospital.

382.title: Cristiano Ronaldo wants to leave Manchester United: Reports
382.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo has told the Premier League club that he wants to leave the club because of his desire to play in the Champions League, UK's The Times newspaper reported on Saturday. The report added that the 37-year-old Portuguese footballer believes that he can play at the elite level for another "three of four years".

383.title: Pic of Tom Cruise's stunt from new 'Mission Impossible' surfaces
383.article_body: A picture has surfaced online showing actor Tom Cruise dangling from the wing of a plane as it does a nosedive and then performs a barrel roll. The stunt is from his upcoming film 'Mission: Impossible – Dead Reckoning Part One'. Tom reportedly also rides a motorcycle off the edge of a cliff and parachutes off in the film.

384.title: Katariya scores as India hold England to 1-1 draw in their women's hockey WC 2022 opener
384.article_body: Vandana Katariya scored in the 28th minute as India held England to a 1-1 draw in their women's hockey World Cup 2022 opener on Sunday. Katariya's equaliser came 19 minutes after England's Isabelle Petter opened the scoring. India will next face China in their Pool B clash on Tuesday. The World Cup is being held in Spain and Netherlands.

385.title: Hope to play Wimbledon one more time: 8-time champion Federer
385.article_body: Eight-time champion Roger Federer said he hopes to play Wimbledon "one more time". Attending a special ceremony to mark the 100th anniversary of Centre Court on Sunday, Federer stated, "This court has given me my biggest wins and my biggest losses." The Swiss hasn't played a competitive match since losing in quarter-final of last year's Championships to Poland's Hubert Hurkacz.

386.title: Pics show the moment a woman was eaten by shark in Egypt
386.article_body: A footage of a 68-year-old tourist from Austria being attacked by a shark in Egypt has surfaced online, following which the country's Red Sea Governorate ordered closure of several Red Sea beaches. The woman died in an ambulance after losing an arm and a leg in the attack. The footage showed the woman trying to swim back to shore.

387.title: I should have been a mom at 19, I was ready but it got delayed: Sushmita
387.article_body: Speaking about becoming a mother, actress Sushmita Sen said she wanted to adopt much earlier. "I was delayed as far as I was concerned, I should've been a mom at 19, I was ready," she said. "I...knew it was time and during Miss Universe is the first time I entered an adoption centre...Something inside [me] was not okay," she added.

388.title: 'Friends' creator gives $4mn to University due to guilt over show's lack of diversity
388.article_body: 'Friends' co-creator Marta Kauffman has said she's donating $4 million to Brandeis University after feeling "embarrassed" by and "guilty" over the sitcom's lack of diversity. Kauffman is donating the sum for an endowed professorship in the African and African American Studies Department. "It took me a long time to begin to understand how I internalised systemic racism," she said.

389.title: Ukrainian forces hit Russian military logistics base in Melitopol
389.article_body: Ukrainian forces struck a Russian military logistics base in Russia-occupied Melitopol on Sunday, the city's exiled mayor Ivan Fedorov said. "At 3 o'clock (0000 GMT) and 5 o'clock (0200 GMT), there were over 30 strikes on a single military base," Fedorov stated. A Russia-installed official confirmed the Ukrainian strikes but no information was provided regarding the target of the strikes.

390.title: KCR has no care for unemployment, only wants his son to be CM: Shah
390.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao has no concern for the unemployed youth and only wants his son to be the CM of the state. Shah added he doesn't care about the people's source of livelihood, adding that the next term is reserved neither for his son nor him, but for BJP.

391.title: Telangana govt has become a symbol of corruption: Piyush Goyal
391.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday said that the Telangana government has become a symbol of corruption, adding that the state's residents want a change. Goyal further stated that members from the same family hold key positions in the state government. His remarks came on the second day of the BJP's national executive meet, which was held in Secunderabad.

392.title: Will prove majority with 166 votes in tomorrow's floor test: Maha Deputy CM
392.article_body: Ahead of the newly-formed Maharashtra government's floor test in the Assembly on Monday, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday said, "We will prove our majority with 166 votes in tomorrow's vote of confidence." "The youngest Speaker candidate won the Speaker election with 164 votes today as 2 MLAs couldn't come due to health issues," Fadnavis added.

393.title: Kanye West sued for copyright infringement over sample on 'Flowers'
393.article_body: A copyright infringement lawsuit has been filed against rapper Kanye West for allegedly using a sample on his song 'Flowers' from his new album 'Donda 2'. Musician Marshall Jefferson has alleged that a sample from his 1986 song 'Move Your Body (House Music Anthem)' is "repeated at least 22 times throughout" 'Flowers' without gaining permission or providing compensation.

394.title: Death toll from landslide in Manipur's Noney reaches 42; 20 still missing
394.article_body: The death toll due to the landslide at Tupul railway station in Manipur's Noney increased to 42, after eight more bodies were recovered from under the debris during a search operation on Sunday. As per reports, the search operation may take a few more days. Around 20 persons are reportedly still missing.

395.title: Our fighter jets to guard Slovakia's airspace from Sept: Czech PM
395.article_body: Czech Republic's PM Petr Fiala said on Sunday that the country's fighter jets will begin guarding neighbouring Slovakia's airspace from September. The move comes after Slovakia requested its NATO allies to patrol its airspace as it decided to ground its Russian-made MiG-29 fighter jets. The MiG-29 fighter jets are likely to be sent to Ukraine amid the ongoing Russian invasion.

396.title: Centre to declare startup rankings of states on July 4
396.article_body: The results of the 3rd Ranking of States' on Support to Start-up Ecosystems will be released by Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Monday. Conducted by the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT), 24 states and 7 Union Territories participated in the exercise. The rankings encourage states, UTs to strengthen support to the startup ecosystem, the government stated.

397.title: World no. 66 Bouzkova reaches 1st Grand Slam quarters at Wimbledon
397.article_body: World number 66 Marie Bouzkova has reached her first Grand Slam quarter-final after beating France's Caroline Garcia 7-5, 6-2 in fourth round at Wimbledon on Sunday. "If you would tell me before the tournament started I'd be in the quarters, I probably wouldn't believe you," said Bouzkova. The 23-year-old Czech will next face either third-seeded Ons Jabeur or Elise Mertens.

398.title: Virat Kohli blows a kiss after taking catch to dismiss Bairstow, video goes viral
398.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli blew a kiss after taking a catch to dismiss Jonny Bairstow in England's first innings in the rescheduled fifth Test. Bairstow was dismissed on the bowling of Mohammad Shami. Bairstow scored 106 runs off 140 deliveries. Earlier in the innings, the duo were seen sledging each other.

399.title: Video shows truck powered by jet engines exploding while racing planes in US, 1 killed
399.article_body: The 40-year-old driver of a truck that was powered by jet engines was killed during a US airshow after the vehicle exploded. The accident was caught on video and it showed the vehicle catching on fire while racing two planes that were flying above it. Chris Darnell was killed while driving the truck at 300 miles (483 km) per hour.

400.title: Fan walked up my building's stairs to meet me, it was scary: Kiara
400.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani revealed that a fan once walked up all the stairs of her building to meet her, adding she lives on a very high floor. She said he wanted to tell her how much she means to him. "I was like...'Why? You could've just taken the lift...But don't come to my house next time, it's...scary also'," Kiara said.

401.title: Our approach is to dominate Sri Lanka Women in 2nd ODI: Vastrakar
401.article_body: India Women all-rounder Pooja Vastrakar said her side's approach is to dominate Sri Lanka Women in the second ODI in Pallekele. "We'll have our first game approach in the second match. And we would like to win the series 3-0," she added. The match will be played on Monday. India are leading the three-match series 1-0.
